reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports by mid-March 2010 and a full report by the end of April 2010
summary:
13. Reaffirms previous resolutions, calling for protection of civilians, implementation of recommendations on children and armed conflict, and investigation of abuses.

14. Renews UNOCI mandate until 31 May 2010 to support free, fair, and transparent elections.

15. Requests UNOCI to support parties in implementing Ouagadougou Political Agreement tasks, provide technical and logistical support to Independent Electoral Commission.

16. Intends to raise UNOCI personnel level to 7950 if needed, upon Secretary-General's analysis.

17. Stresses accountability of Ivorian parties for respecting electoral timeline.

18. Requests UNOCI to assist Facilitator and Special Representative.

19. Requests Secretary-General to ensure UNOCI compliance with zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation.

20. Extends authorization for French forces to support UNOCI until 31 May 2010.

21. Intends to review UNOCI mandate, French forces authorization, and troop level by 31 May 2010.

22. Requests Secretary-General to provide updates on UNOCI's future.

23. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
